New Records: Argentina won their fourth straight penalty shootout since Emi Martinez became their first-choice goalkeeper
Key Match Events: Lisandro Martinez scored the first goal for Argentina in the first half
Kevin Rodriguez scored a stoppage-time equalizer to force the shootout
Lionel Messi missed from the spot after a late Ecuador equalizer
Emi Martinez made two saves before Nicolas Otamendi scored the decisive penalty to book a semifinal spot
Pre-Game Insights: Ecuador tried to contain Argentina by pressing higher than expected and finding success cutting off service to Argentina's attacking players
Argentina struggled to find their midfielders in dangerous places and looked mostly to the wings to try to create chances
Post-Match Reflections: Lionel Scaloni praised his team's performance and said they 'always react' regardless of how they play
Emi Martinez said he wasn't ready to go home and that the team deserved to advance
Rodrigo De Paul praised Martinez's performance, saying he is an 'animal in goal'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch conditions were described as 'fast and choppy' and 'unpredictable'
Ecuador limited Messi to just 32 touches, his fewest in a competitive game in which he played the full 90 minutes for Argentina since 2011
Others: Argentina will travel to MetLife Stadium and await the winner of Friday's quarterfinal between Venezuela and Canada
Argentina have now won four straight penalty shootouts since Emi Martinez became their first-choice goalkeeper
